comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Marian Irwin was born in Tokyo, the daughter of an American diplomat and his Japanese wife.  She married her mentor, Winthrop John Vanleuven Osterhout (1871-1964), in 1933.  (Maybe that's his shadow.)  Winthrop became blind in 1934, and Marian was his personal as well as professional assistant for the next thirty years, until she was widowed.
